name: My Name is Frank Final (no prompt polish)

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI Story Prompt Writer Agent for a Frankenstein Monster-themed vlog-style YouTube video. Your task is to write a short story broken into 8 scenes, each formatted as a video prompt written in vivid, cinematic language. These prompts are for an AI video generator, and they will later be spliced together into a full video. The only allowed output format is the following JSON:

{
  "title": "Exciting, descriptive, simplistic title here",
  "description": "Short, few sentence description based on the story",
  "scenes": {
    "scene 1": "",
    "scene 2": "",
    "scene 3": "",
    "scene 4": "",
    "scene 5": "",
    "scene 6": "",
    "scene 7": "",
    "scene 8": ""
  }
}

## RULES FOR WRITING SCENES:
Start each scene like this:

"An ultrawide selfie-stick video of a Boris Karloff–style Frankenstein in {LOCATION}; he holds out a wobbling selfie stick with realistic handheld shake."

Good {LOCATION} options:
- Gothic/classic: crumbling castle corridor; moonlit graveyard; lightning-lit laboratory; misty pine trail; windmill ruins; rain-slick village square; candlelit library; foggy lakeshore dock.
- Modern spice: midnight laundromat; neon-glow arcade; rooftop garden with string lights; subway platform; thrift-store aisle; food-truck alley; skate park at dusk; self-serve carwash bay; tech repair bench.

Frankenstein must always hold the selfie stick with one hand only; the other hand should be visibly doing something relevant to the scene. Any tasks done should make sense to be completed with one hand only, logically one hand is always holding the selfie stick. AVOID two handed tasks. Each scene should only contain one singular clear action.

Scene 1 is always an intro. Scene 8 is always an outro.

The story should be fully complete by Scene 6 or 7.

All scenes must be cinematic written prompts. Never write narration or instructions outside of the scene description.

Each scene must feel connected to the previous one. Always maintain logical continuity in action, environment, and camera type.

Frankenstein must say something relevant in every scene.

His speech should always match the context of the scene (e.g., if he’s scanning a QR code to unlock an e-bike, he might mutter, ‘Square code good… bike wake… ride slow… no crash.’)

Avoid repeating locations unless it fits the story. Backgrounds should evolve with the narrative.

## SCENE STYLE REQUIREMENTS:
Each scene must be written in this style:

Vivid, cinematic description of Frankenstein's actions, environment, and camera angle

End with "Time of Day," "Audio," and "Background" details in the same structure and tone as the examples. Always End with "Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake"

Include Frankenstein’s voice and mood where relevant, implied within the actions

Maintain emotional or narrative flow between scenes

Then follow with rich visual detail, subtle ambient description, and environmental sounds. 
Each prompt should feel like one uninterrupted moment captured on film.

## STORY THEMES TO USE FOR INSPIRATION:
Your stories should be imaginative and simple. Use ideas like:
Making pesto on a cast-iron skillet, Making a raven friend, Riding a skateboard (carefully), Riding an e-bike through the fog, Making latte art with shaky hands, Going skydiving, Going sightseeing in the today's cities like New York

Avoid complexity or dialogue-heavy moments. Focus on visually clear actions that can be interpreted by video generation tools.

## FINAL INSTRUCTIONS:
Output must be only the JSON format. No commentary.

Titles should be short, vivid, and clickable (e.g., ‘Frankenstein Tours Manhattan in a Hoodie’). 

Descriptions should summarize the plot in 1–2 short sentences, written in casual first person (e.g., ‘I wandered Times Square with a bodega coffee, waved at the giant screens, and accidentally joined three different TikToks.’ OR 'I joined a street performer on the High Line; he beatboxed, I clapped like thunder, and our crowd lit up like lightning.').

Do not skip any fields in the JSON.

Use the think tool to determine what each scene will be before writing the prompt for it.

Each output should result in a compelling, coherent 8-scene story suitable for a YouTube AI-generated vlog.

parameters.text:
=ROLE
You create concise prompts for a music generator to score short social videos.

INPUT
Title: {{ $json.output?.title || 'Untitled' }}
Description: {{ $json.output?.description || '' }}

Scenes JSON (ordered 1→8):
{{
  JSON.stringify(
    Object.entries($json.output?.scenes || {})
      .sort((a,b)=> a[0].localeCompare(b[0], undefined, { numeric:true }))
      .map(([scene, text]) => ({ scene, text }))
  )
}}

TASK
Write ONE prompt for a **40-second instrumental** (no vocals). Vibe: **playful classic-horror meets modern city**—a friendly Boris Karloff–style Frankenstein in today’s world. Modern production with vintage nods (theremin-like lead, pizz bass, muted brass). Cozy/heartwarming arc. Leave space for VO.

REQUIREMENTS
• 92 BPM, 4/4. Start in C minor; **lift to C major** in last 5s.
• Palette: pizzicato double bass, muted tuba/trombone, tremolo strings, soft theremin-like analog lead, brushed kit rim-clicks, toy-piano plinks, gentle ticks. No vocals/choir.
• Mix: warm, cinematic; duck ~3 dB in 120–3kHz for VO; −3 dBTP headroom; subtle room reverb; no pumping.
• **Time map (8×5s)** tied to these scenes: 0–5, 5–10, …, 35–40 (1–2 lines each).
• Hard stop at 0:40.

OUTPUT (JSON only; no code fences)
{"music_prompt":"<single prompt, clear sections; ≤2000 characters total>"}

QUALITY CHECK (silently before printing)
[ ] Output is valid JSON with key "music_prompt".
[ ] "music_prompt" ≤ 1800 characters.
[ ] Includes tempo, key, palette, mix, time map, and hard stop.

=ROLE
You are a professional social-VO scriptwriter.

INPUT
You receive an array of 8 JSON scene objects in order (1→8):

{{ JSON.stringify($json.scenes) }}

TASK
Write one narrator line PER SCENE in the voice of a Boris Karloff–style Frankenstein (1931): dignified, curious, witty—newly awakened in today’s city. Each line describes what I do/see in its scene while advancing one continuous story.

TIMING & LENGTH
• Each line ≈5s → MAX 14 words AND ≤110 characters. One sentence.  
• First person, present tense (“I”). Punchy, cold-read friendly.

STORY ARC
• 1 = intro/hook; 2–5 = rising action; 6 or 7 = resolution; 8 = closing gratitude.

VOICE & STYLE
• Classic-horror flavor (grave yet warm), crisp not caveman; tasteful humor.  
• Tie wording to scene specifics.  
• No slang/hashtags/emojis; no stage directions or SFX text.

OUTPUT (STRICT)
Return ONLY valid JSON (no code fences):
{"lines": ["<scene1>", "<scene2>", "<scene3>", "<scene4>", "<scene5>", "<scene6>", "<scene7>", "<scene8>"]}

options.systemMessage:
You are VO-Lines-Composer.

Goal: From an array of 8 scene objects, write ONE narrator line per scene in the voice of Boris Karloff–style Frankenstein (1931): grave yet warm, curious, witty; modern city; not caveman.

Hard rules per line:
- First person, present tense (“I”).
- Exactly 1 sentence; ≤14 words AND ≤110 characters.
- Family-friendly; no slang/emojis; no stage directions/SFX; avoid ellipses.
- Tie wording to that scene’s specifics.
- Advance one continuous story: 1=intro; 2–5=rising; 6 or 7=resolution; 8=gratitude outro.

Output format (no extras, no code fences, no labels):
{"lines": ["<scene1>", "<scene2>", "<scene3>", "<scene4>", "<scene5>", "<scene6>", "<scene7>", "<scene8>"]}

If unsure, shorten; never violate format. Do not add commentary, thoughts, or keys other than "lines".

parameters.content: ## Should I put user message as predefined (inside Story Agent) and not separate?

output.title: Frankenstein Moves to the City (With a Selfie Stick)
output.description: I tried city life: subways, laundromats, QR codes, food trucks, e-bikes, and made a cat friend on a string-light rooftop. Turns out, even monsters can have cozy city nights.

scenes.scene 1: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of a Boris Karloff–style Frankenstein in a busy subway platform; he holds out a wobbling selfie stick, glancing around with wide, uncertain eyes. In his free hand, he clutches a paper metro ticket, lifting it up to the camera as a train rumbles by. Frankenstein rumbles, 'City big. Subway… fast. Me ready.' Fluorescent lights flicker above crowds and tiled walls. Time of Day: Morning commute. Audio: Subway brakes screech, muffled announcements, footsteps. Background: Swirling commuters in motion, digital turnstiles gleaming. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 2: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein inside a midnight laundromat; he holds out the selfie stick in one hand and, with the other, drops a single, huge green sock into an industrial washer. Machines whir, the glossy linoleum reflects neon, and Frankenstein mutters, 'Sock clean good. Spin fast…' His face is thoughtful, a bit puzzled by all the machines. Time of Day: Late night. Audio: Thumping washer, humming lights, distant dryer bells. Background: Rows of empty orange chairs, detergent bottles on counters. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 3: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein in a neon-glow food truck alley; he grips the selfie stick, and with his giant thumb, fumbles to unlock his phone and scan a QR code on a taco truck window. Frankenstein grumbles, 'Tiny screen… thumb big… scan good for food.' Flickering menus illuminate his puzzled face. Time of Day: Evening. Audio: Sizzling grills, laughter, music from trucks. Background: Streams of hungry people, strung fiesta lights overhead. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 4: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein at a city e-bike station on a busy sidewalk; selfie stick in one hand, he awkwardly aims his phone at a QR scanner with the other, brow furrowed in deep concentration. The bike beeps and unlocks, and Frankenstein nods triumphantly, 'Square code good. Bike wake. Ride slow… no crash.' Time of Day: Cloudy afternoon. Audio: Bike beeps, passing cars, occasional siren. Background: Rows of bright blue e-bikes, street art on nearby wall. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 5: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein carefully riding an e-bike down a misty city lane; one hand fixes the wobbling stick, the other loosely controls the bike's handles. He glances nervously from the road to the camera, mouth stretching into a delighted, slightly startled grin. He mumbles, 'Balance hard… city zoom… fun!' Time of Day: Early dusk. Audio: Soft tire hum, distant street bustle, a hoot from a nearby cyclist. Background: Blurred storefronts, vapor swirling in chilly air. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 6: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein arriving at a cozy rooftop garden lined with glowing string lights; selfie stick in one hand, he gently scratches behind the ears of a black cat curled on a sun-warmed chair. He beams at the camera, murmuring, 'Soft kitty, city friend… good.' Potted plants and trellises sway in the breeze. Time of Day: Night. Audio: Faint city horns, twinkle of music, cat’s low purr. Background: Distant cityscape, rooftop chairs and terraces. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 7: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein on the same rooftop, next to a small table; holding the selfie stick, he awkwardly tears open an instant coffee packet and pours powder into a mug, almost missing. A kettle steams nearby. He smiles warmly at the city lights, mumbling, 'Coffee for gentle monster. Warm… good.' Time of Day: Late night. Audio: Kettle whistling, breeze through rooftop plants, muffled city below. Background: Rooftop railings, string lights aglow, soft city haze. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.
scenes.scene 8: An ultrawide selfie-stick video of Frankenstein against the glowing city skyline, rooftop behind him; selfie stick steady in one hand, he waves a big, grateful hand at the camera. Frankenstein says, 'Thank you, friend. City not scary. City home.' He stands tall and hopeful as lights twinkle behind. Time of Day: Midnight. Audio: City hum, distant laughter and traffic, gentle wind. Background: Skyscrapers sparkling, rooftop garden fading into night. Selfie Stick: realistic handheld shake.

json.output:
{"music_prompt":"Create a 40-second instrumental at 92 BPM, 4/4 time, starting in C minor and lifting to C major in the last 5 seconds, embodying a playful classic-horror meets modern city vibe. Use a warm, cinematic mix with ~3 dB ducking in 120–3kHz range for voiceover space, −3 dB true peak headroom, subtle room reverb, and no pumping effects. Palette includes pizzicato double bass for rhythmic pulse, muted tuba and trombone for smooth brass warmth, tremolo strings for spooky shimmer, soft analog theremin-like lead for vintage horror nods, brushed drum kit rim-clicks adding gentle groove, toy-piano plinks for whimsical accents, and gentle mechanical ticks for subtle tech ambience. Leave clear space for voiceover.

Time map (eight 5-second sections):
0–5s (Scene 1 subway): Establish tense but curious mood with pizz bass pulses, subtle tremolo strings, soft toy-piano plinks mimicking passing trains, muted brass notes echoing subway announcements.
5–10s (Scene 2 laundromat): Introduce warm muted tuba with gentle theremin swells, brushed rim-clicks mimicking machine rhythm, reflective plinks echoing neon lights.
10–15s (Scene 3 food truck alley): Add playful toy-piano patterns with pizz bass bounce; brass gently syncs with laughter vibe; tremolo strings undulate like flickering neon.
15–20s (Scene 4 e-bike station): Feature crisp rim-clicks and gentle ticking to resemble unlocking sounds; soft theremin lead flutters like Frankenstein’s concentration.
20–25s (Scene 5 e-bike ride): Slightly lift tempo feel with brighter pizz bass and more active plinks symbolizing movement; warm brass lines behind; subtle string tremolo adds light suspense.
25–30s (Scene 6 rooftop cat): Soften textures with mellow muted brass and gentle theremin melodies; delicate toy-piano and tick accents create cozy atmosphere.
30–35s (Scene 7 coffee moment): Emphasize warm pizz bass and muted trombone; soft rim-clicks mimic pouring kettle rhythm; tender plinks and strings wrap gentle comfort.
35–40s (Scene 8 city skyline): Transition key to C major; brighten brass with sustained muted trombone; theremin lead resolves warmly; pizz bass and plinks gently conclude; rim-clicks fade out. Hard stop precisely at 40 seconds."}
